title: Quick Shoot Production from Sweet Potato

tasks.task: Prepare and perform slip production from sweet potatoes.
subtasks: Collect three sweet potato varieties (yellow, purple, and white) from a shopping mall.
Prepare plastic cups with tap water for setting the sweet potatoes.
Cleanly cut sweet potatoes into two sections using a knife.
Insert toothpicks into the cut sections for anchoring in the water.
Maintain water level at least 1 centimeter deep in the cups.
Wait two weeks for shoots to emerge, checking water levels daily.
Identify top and lower portions of the sweet potatoes for shoot production.
Remove shoots carefully using hands when they reach 8-10 cm in length.
Replant shoots into fresh water cups for rooting, ensuring three toothpicks for stability.
Allow shoots to root for one week before transplantation.
Confirm successful rooting with new roots evident after one week.
Transplant rooted shoots into main fields or desired growing medium.

tasks.task: Propagate sweet potatoes through slip production.
subtasks: Collect different varieties of sweet potatoes from a store.
Prepare water-filled containers for the sweet potatoes.
Cut the sweet potatoes in half using a knife.
Insert toothpicks into the cut sides for securing in water.
Monitor water levels to ensure at least 1 cm depth daily.
Wait two weeks for shoots to emerge.
Carefully remove shoots once they reach 8-10 cm in length.
Replant shoots into new containers with water for root development.
Allow shoots to develop roots for one week.
Transplant rooted shoots into growing mediums or fields.
